title: Atomic Layer Deposition (ALD) Process
description: A schema representing the steps and parameters involved in setting up and verifying an Atomic Layer Deposition process.

reactantSelection.description: Selection of precursor and co-reactant based on their reactivity, volatility, and safety.

precursor.description: Chemical used as a precursor in the ALD process.

coReactant.description: Chemical used as a co-reactant in the ALD process.

deliveryMethod.description: Method of delivering the precursor to the reaction chamber.

chemicalComposition.description: Verification of the material's chemical composition post-deposition.

verificationMethods.description: Methods used to verify the chemical composition, e.g., XPS or RBS.

thicknessControl.description: Control and verification of material thickness per cycle.

growthPerCycle.description: The amount of material deposited per cycle, typically measured in nm per cycle.

saturation.description: Optimization of dosing and purge times to ensure self-limiting growth.

dosingTime.description: Time for dosing the precursor or co-reactant, measured in seconds.

purgeTime.description: Time for purging the reactor chamber, measured in seconds.

materialProperties.description: Assessment of the physical and chemical properties of the deposited film.

temperatureDependence.description: Observation of GPC under varying substrate temperatures to find the ALD window.

temperatureRange.description: Range of substrate temperatures tested, e.g., 50°C to 350°C.

uniformity.description: Assessment of film thickness uniformity across large substrate areas.

variation.description: Permissible variation in film thickness, typically measured in percentage.

conformality.description: Ability of the film to coat 3D structures uniformly.

aspectRatio.description: Aspect ratio of the 3D structures used in testing conformality.

nucleationBehavior.description: Initial growth behavior of the film during the first few ALD cycles.

initialGrowthType.description: Type of initial growth observed, e.g., linear, accelerated, or delayed.

otherAspects.description: Other important aspects of the ALD process development such as safety and reproducibility.

safety.description: Safety considerations for handling chemicals and reaction products.

filmStability.description: Whether the film remains stable under intended environmental conditions.

reproducibility.description: Consistency of film thickness and properties in repeated experiments.
